skill.name: github-project-management
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automation, and sprint planning
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automat...
skill.author: Claude Code

security_audit.summary: This skill provides legitimate GitHub project management capabilities using CLI tools and MCP servers. While it requires broad permissions for GitHub operations and executes external commands, these capabilities are necessary for its stated purpose. The skill uses standard GitHub CLI (gh) and documented MCP tools without any obfuscated or suspicious code patterns.

medium_findings.title: Broad GitHub CLI permissions required
medium_findings.description: The skill requires GitHub CLI with authenticated access and repository permissions. While legitimate for project management, this grants write access to issues, projects, and repository data. Users should ensure they trust the skill operator and understand the scope of permissions being granted.

low_findings.title: External command execution via GitHub Actions
low_findings.description: The skill includes GitHub Actions workflows that execute external commands. While this is standard for CI/CD, it could potentially run arbitrary code if the repository is compromised. The workflow files appear legitimate and follow standard patterns.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub project management with AI swarm coordination
content.value_statement: Managing GitHub projects manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates issue tracking, project board synchronization, and sprint planning using AI swarm coordination for efficient project delivery.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage GitHub issues with automated swarm coordination
Synchronize project boards with real-time status updates
Automate sprint planning and milestone tracking
Convert issues into coordinated swarm tasks
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI authentication and repository permissions
Depends on external MCP servers (ruv-swarm or claude-flow)
May have rate limiting for large-scale operations

use_cases.title: Automated sprint management
use_cases.description: Coordinate sprints with AI agents that automatically assign tasks, track progress, and update project boards based on issue status.

use_cases.title: Issue triage automation
use_cases.description: Automatically label, prioritize, and assign issues to appropriate team members using AI analysis of issue content.

use_cases.title: Cross-team coordination
use_cases.description: Manage issues across multiple repositories and teams with synchronized project boards and automated progress tracking.

prompt_templates.title: Create sprint issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Create GitHub issues for sprint planning with labels, assignees, and swarm coordination for a 2-week sprint focused on API development

prompt_templates.title: Automate issue triage
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze and triage unlabeled GitHub issues, add appropriate labels based on content, and assign to relevant team members

prompt_templates.title: Sync project boards
prompt_templates.prompt: Synchronize issue status across development, QA, and release project boards with real-time updates

prompt_templates.title: Generate progress reports
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate comprehensive progress reports including burndown charts, velocity metrics, and blocker analysis for the current sprint

output_examples.input: Create a coordinated issue for implementing user authentication
output: âœ… Issue #123 created: 'Feature: Implement OAuth2 Authentication'
âœ… Added labels: enhancement, authentication, high-priority
âœ… Swarm initialized with 3 agents: architect, coder, tester
âœ… Added to project board: Development Sprint 15

best_practices: Always initialize swarm coordination for complex issues to enable parallel development and automated tracking
Use consistent labeling strategy across all issues to improve automation accuracy and team communication
Configure bidirectional sync between issues and project boards to maintain real-time status updates
anti_patterns: Avoid creating issues without swarm coordination for complex tasks - this misses automation benefits
Don't manually update project board cards when automated sync is available - this creates inconsistencies
Never skip proper GitHub CLI authentication setup - this causes permission errors during operations

faq.question: Is this compatible with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with GitHub Enterprise Cloud and Server editions using the same GitHub CLI commands.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for large projects?
faq.answer: GitHub API has rate limits of 5000 requests/hour for authenticated users. The skill includes batching to minimize API calls.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with Slack or Teams?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill can send notifications to Slack, Teams, and other platforms using webhook integrations configured in the workflow.

faq.question: How secure is the data handling?
faq.answer: All operations use official GitHub CLI and APIs with OAuth tokens. No data is stored externally - everything stays in your GitHub repository.

faq.question: What if the swarm agents conflict?
faq.answer: The skill uses conflict resolution strategies and maintains audit trails. You can always manually override automated decisions.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Projects automation?
faq.answer: This skill extends GitHub Projects with AI coordination, cross-repository sync, and intelligent task assignment not available in native automation.
